text: - Welcome to Business Builders.
Today we are joined by Manuel Alberto,

President and CEO of
Metro Retail Stores Group.

Manuel, welcome.
- Thank you.
It's my pleasure, thanks for having me.

- Metro started as a homegrown
retail store in Cebu,
and today is one of the largest operators
of supermarkets, department stores
and hypermarkets in the Visayas region.
Manuel, that's a fantastic growth story,
one that spans over 40 years.

In your view, what are
some of the key drivers
that have contributed to the success
of the Metro brand in the Philippines?

- Our brand mission is to
be a dependable partner
to hardworking moms and dads who strive
for a better lifestyle for their family.

So providing a one-stop
assortment of basic essentials,
access to affordable and unique finds
in an easy, comfortable,
and fast modern shopping environment
is our winning value proposition.

- Resilience is something
that we hear a lot

from our customers, especially
in terms of the capability
to recover from adverse situations
that impact business operations.

How has Metro Retail
responded to such incidents

and how has technology
helped build resiliency
in your business?
- We are a four decades old company

and we had our shares
of blows from the earth,

wind, fire, name it, and
including the pandemic.
Metro was not spared
from the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic.
During the quarantine period,
all our department stores were mandated

to temporarily close,
which, as you can imagine,
led to huge losses in sales.
Amid all of these challenging conditions,

we recalibrated our game
plan with the main objective
on how we will maintain our brand equity
and our relevance with our customers

with the right merchandising
and marketing pivots.
We established seamless physical

and digital shopping innovations
like our Metro Pabili
or personal shopping through texts

or telecall assistance,
which are patronized mostly

by our moms who are used to
going to the stores personally,
or our digital option shopmetro.ph,

which serves our more
tech savvy customers.

Our e-commerce platform was
actually built on the cloud
at the onset of the COVID pandemic.

By using the cloud
infrastructure, we were able

to set up the site and
continuously improve it
despite the lockdown restrictions.

Through the cloud, we easily
expanded our online platform
to add more servicing stores.
- These are really valuable insights

for a lot of businesses out
there facing similar challenges.

What outcomes or
improvements are you seeing
after moving to AWS Cloud?
- First, Metro saved about 60% in the cost
of operating the migrated systems
due to lower infrastructure costs.

In the past, we were
doing a technology refresh
every five years for our ERP system.
We would undergo a sizing exercise

to project the system requirements
for the succeeding years.
What we realized then

is that we were actually
underutilizing its capacity,
meaning we were paying
for resources that were not being used.

With AWS, we only commit
to resources that we plan
to use over the near term.

Secondly, AWS provided
scalability and allowed us

to easily adjust our
resources based on demand.

So being on the cloud allowed
us to downscale our resources
and save on operating costs,
something that we could not do
if we had still our own servers.

So being in the cloud also
gave Metro flexibility

and accessibility, which
enabled our employees
to access files and applications

from any of our location
at almost any time.

- I'm gonna ask you to
peek into the future now.
Tell us what comes next for Metro Retail.
- In the next three years,
we have framed our IT strategic priorities

that will focus on areas
of customer experience
and unified commerce.

Initially, we are prioritizing
the transformation

of our customer loyalty
enrollment process into digital

to allow our customers the
option to register online

for membership, but further
down the road, we want
to be able to use analytics

to understand our
customers' shopping behavior
so that we can curate specialized offers
that are relevant to their needs.
- I really enjoyed our conversation.

It's inspiring to see Metro
Retail's transformation
from a family run retailer

to a fast growing
resilient public company.
Thank you for joining us, Manuel.
- Thank you, it's my pleasure.
